'''''Amanita virosiformis''''', commonly known as the '''narrow-spored destroying angel''', is a poisonous [[basidiomycete]] [[fungus]], one of many in the genus ''[[Amanita]]''. Originally described from [[Florida]], it is found from coastal North Carolina through to eastern Texas in the southeastern United States.<ref>[http://www.njcc.com/~ret/amanita/species/virosifo.html]</ref>
